61864689

Okie dokie. I understand why so many elements of Freemasonry, and secret societies strongly emphasize the lack of even appearing to be banded together behind the scenes. I totally understand why because anyone with a triple digit IQ will recognize when 20 to 30 people who don’t know each other all start, saying the same thing and attacking the same shit.


Once they outsourced all of this talking points to third world to cover online forums, the consistent attacks are essentially assigned that you are over the target.

61867144
>>61866917
This is really the bull case cry for stacking firearms and putting aside enough to buy sell swords. The government will do anything they think they can get away with which I why I don't think even bail ins are certain, you can do those overnight without kicking a single door but there will still be hell to pay in the morning. While stackers are a smaller population most holdings require, or rather will at such time require, going door to door to seize assets in a country in which one can put together an AR for $350-$400 and drop in FRTs can be had for as little as $100. All this against the population and asset class pairing most likely to own firearms. The logistics don't make sense. You'll see heavy taxes, threats of taxes, capital controls and possibly if briefly bans on sales after a set date. None of this yields as much gold or silver as paying an above market rate. Question is, is there anything worth trading for. If I got a deed to a substantial amount of the land the federal government loves to horde so much I could see myself parting with all (some) of my specie. Nobody can be all stick and no carrot and win. This is why in bank bail ins you atleast get shares in a bank that has recently defaulted.

it was enough

Same sticks now 70% less per stick

Been making more per day not working
2026 is van life friendly

>>61867173
funny, always thought it was a stock image pic girls reacting to a dude with a big dick

61868353
>>61865873
>But RAM prices are still at ATH?
not quite
DDR5 is down 15% from ATH December 31st.
ECC DDR5 is down 10% from ATH December 31st.
Since then, enterprises with projected surplus in 2026 kept the ECC propped up but it is dropping
ECC DDR4 is down 40% in 3 months, still double YTD, but free falling is not an exaggeration
DDR4 RAM hit prices so high that it was cheaper to consolidate legacy deployments running DDR4 to DDR5
Before this year ends, we will be back to 120% of 2025 lows.

item.title: Need 10 Players to test this game — 8 replies — 13.1/hr
item.content:encoded:
Need 10 Players to test this game

Open thread • Replies: 8 • Updated: 2026-02-18 04:37 UTC

OP

I built a 1v1 trading game on Base.

How it works:
Both players stake $1 USDC
You trade a synthetic asset (NOVA) for 60 seconds
Best P&L wins the pot

No tokens needed. No sign up. Just connect wallet and play.

Looking for 10 players to battle this week.
Drop a if you want in.

playmomentum.app

Early replies (first 3)

61868771
>>61868759
How do I know you aren't some disgusting Indian trying to scam me and hack my wallet?

61868780
>>61868759
I'm not connecting a wallet to that but I'll bump your thread out of interest

61868808
Fair question. The code is fully open — smart contracts verified on BaseScan, no proxy, no admin mint, no way to touch your funds. The game uses EIP-3009 (gasless USDC approval) so you sign exactly what you stake, nothing more. Contract: https://basescan.org/address/0xe25f33862c0c0357e8bB62bE89C18c560Ea51D5f — read it yourself. I'm a solo dev, not a team of 50 with a Cayman Islands LLC. If I wanted to scam I'd pick a method that doesn't take 8 months to build.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61868811
Appreciate the bump anon. If you change your mind, Practice mode doesn't need any funds — just a wallet connection to try the trading UI. No USDC required.

61868821
>>61868771
Fair question. The code is fully open — smart contracts verified on BaseScan, no proxy, no admin mint, no way to touch your funds. The game uses EIP-3009 (gasless USDC approval) so you sign exactly what you stake, nothing more. Contract: https://basescan.org/address/0xe25f33862c0c0357e8bB62bE89C18c560Ea51D5f — read it yourself. I'm a solo dev, not a team of 50 with a Cayman Islands LLC. If I wanted to scam I'd pick a method that doesn't take 8 months to build.

Open thread • Replies: 3 • Updated: 2026-02-18 05:08 UTC

OP

that one fag keeps posting his SAS b2b threads and that other fag keeps posting that 'funerals are a scam' thread. Here's my question- recently experienced something similar at a Vet office- they opened at 7 AM but the Vet wasn't in until 8:45 and the pet needed urgent help, but the only people in the office were.... I don't even know what they do since they weren't legally able to do anyhting, they're just there drawing a paycheck.

Why is it that people in jobs like Vet or medical tech or even just straight up entry level doctor/nurse who have recently graduated struggle to find work even though there is massive demand for these people? What is the snag in the "we need a medivet for our Horse surgeries" and then "we're not going to hire your faggot ass though, we're just going to go without". Why is the current economy so shit at actually placing people in the places their education would matter and can develop their skills further, when there is in fact demand pushed along by people willing to spend money on these services?

Business just doesn't seem to "work" anymore, the people getting hired are meaningless pencil pushers and office admins at the university entry exam office, or the hospital front desk, or the lawyer's receptionist but then they constantly have a dearth of actual professionals, while there are a bunch of educated but not-hired-ever people in these kinds of professional careers looking for basic bitch entry level work.

The inefficiency and refusal to hire confuses me so much when they end up losing business to businesses willing to actually do their fucking jobs.

61868026
This isn't an /an/ thread btw I know it may confuse retards but I'm specifically talking about the lack of businesses and person ell to satisfy demand, while there is a constant problem where people go to college to -do shit- and then no one will hire them, resulting in constant delays and dilemmas since 2020.

61868115
>>61868020
Not sure. For medical, possibly regulation? Really the hardest part of doing business isn't the actual work it's the connections and networking. It took a client pool of 5,000 local and nation wide businesses to support TWO people - my boss and I, in the printing business. I could easily do the professional work required but amassing the client pool took 5 years of operating at a loss every year.

I went to Office Depot the other day to buy an office chair. After trying out all the chairs I point out the one I want and try to buy it. The guy tried to check me out for 15 minutes at the register before telling me the chair is out of stock at all Office Depot locations. I just went home and bought it on Amazon, lol.

61864989
>>61863206
2006 was giving out loans like candy to people who had absolutely no way of ever servicing them
this then resulted in a lot of forced selling into a no bid market as all of this inventory was cleared when the bubble popped

right now we dont have excessive loans, quite the opposite retards arent given insane loans this is legit existing money bidding up hard assets because so much money got printed and it has to go somewhere
you dont get a crash in housing without forced selling and who is going to force sell his real estate at low prices without the bank margin calling them
unlike stocks which are completely fungible and its price is set at the margin, housing isnt and the owner can just sit on the asset forever and not be forced to take any offer being made at market price

to disrupt this 'bubble' you need the government unprinting the money supply (lol, lmao even) or you need a large section of boomers dying off and leaving their heirs with no way to pay the taxes/upkeep and force dump it
the second one is the only realistic option, tho there is also the risk that the heirs can pay for the inheritance and real estate is now permanently locked up in magnate hands and the nation reduced to permarenting slave

61865001
It really isn't mentioned enough that our "recovery" after 2008 was just setting interest rates to 0 for 10 years.
